pageContext.claim: “They both endorsed me, the only time they've ever endorsed a presidential candidate, OK? And they endorsed us unanimously.”
pageContext.analysis: Federal agencies cannot endorse political candidates. The unions representing Immigration and Customs Enforcement agents and Border Patrol agents did endorse Trump. Both groups said Trump was their first-ever endorsement. But they did not do so unanimously. The National Border Patrol Council endorsement was based just on the vote of 11 union leaders, which sparked controversy among union members. Agents in El Paso, in a 14-to-13 vote, narrowly failed to have the local union disavow the endorsement.
